# QUIC-Fire - Fast Physics-Based Model

## Overview
QUIC-Fire is a fast physics-based model developed by Los Alamos National Laboratory, designed to simulate wildfire behavior with a focus on fast-running physics computations. This model is crucial for wildfire researchers and practitioners as it provides a reliable tool for understanding fire dynamics, particularly in the context of urban interfaces and smoke dispersion. By incorporating GPU acceleration techniques, QUIC-Fire offers a unique advantage in delivering rapid and accurate simulations for operational fire management.

- Specialized in modeling fire behavior in urban interface scenarios
- Advanced capabilities for simulating smoke dispersion
- Utilizes GPU acceleration for enhanced performance
